text: Mario to the Rescue, hell yeah! I love this track. You know Supra, I'm beginning to do the same in my channel as I'd like to make a comment in every track I share every week. This is one of my fav tracks of the game, with Gusty Garden, Egg Galaxy and Buoy Base Galaxy :D
author: MarioSoundtrack

text:
If not Galaxy 3, at least a massive 3D game like 64, Sunshine, or Galaxy that really brings something new to the table and takes what they did well in the previous games and expand on it.
3D Land and World were great games for trying to balance out those who found 3D too confusing or the NSMB series too repetitive, but it'd be really nice to continue on this line of crazy platforming and possible storytelling.
author: Rocket Ken

text: I still need to play this. : (
author: daneofurexistence

text: The whole SMG soundtrack's wondrous and classic, but this track's one of my favorites.
author: Jonochrome

text: I miss the Wii era already. Nintendo are choosing the 'easy option' far too often, these days. Game quality is suffering, yet releases are no more frequent (perhaps quite a bit less frequent, in fact) than before. Seems baffling to me. They just don't seem committed to making the best games possible any more. Starfox and Zelda this year will be hugely pivotal for Nintendo's reputation among long-time gamers, I believe. When's the last time it was this unsatisfying to be a Nintendo fan?
author: YummyBananaFish

text: Yeah like the wii Era wasn't bad enough,  the wii u is worse. It feels their playing it safer and safer each console with each game
